name: Black is Back Trivia Game | Idioms and Proverbs | 10 Questions

questions.text: Many stars in the 1950s were described by this word or phrase because someone claimed they were Communist. What black word or phrase applied to them?
questions.explanation:
blacklisted.

	Among those blacklisted were Paul Robeson and Paul Draper.  The majority of the people accused of being Communists were not actually Communist, but the scare was so severe that people were being accused left and right. This was known as McCarthyism, and in most cases proper evidence did not exist to prove that the people being accused were Communists. For many, it totally ruined their careers. (wikipedia.com)

questions.text: If you are black and blue, what is wrong with you?
options: You are of mixed racial background
questions.explanation:
You have a bruise.

	Another name for a bruise is a contusion.  Bruises usually look purple and blue in color. Sometimes they also look yellowish because they change color over time as they begin to heal.

questions.text: It's election time at my local club, and I have decided to vote against someone who has applied for admission. What did I do to that person?
questions.explanation:
blackballed.

	This comes from a time when to vote people were given a white ball and a black ball. To vote you put in white for support and black for oppose. Today voting is done by secret ballots, but there was a time when everyone could see you vote.

questions.text: In the US the biggest shopping day of the year for in-store (not online) shopping is given what name?
questions.explanation:
Black Friday.

	Black Friday is the day after Thanksgiving in the United States, falling on the 4th Friday of November. Stores have their big sales that day because it is the start of the holiday season.

questions.text: "If you don't bring me $100,000 I'm going to share that picture I have of you and that other woman, Mr. Senator."  What would I be doing if I spoke this sentence for real?
questions.explanation:
blackmailing.

	Blackmail is an illegal way to get someone to do something for you. It usually involves a threat to release information (whether it be verbal or by picture) that the person would not want out; they will therefore do whatever is needed to keep the information safe. Most often it is people with money or influence that get blackmailed.

questions.text: What female spider often eats its mate after mating?
questions.explanation:
Black Widow Spider & Black Widow.

	The Black Widow Spider belongs to the genius Latrodectus. The most common species is the Black Widow Spider, but there are 32 species in that genus.

questions.text: If someone tried to sell a baby, where would they sell it?
questions.explanation:
Black market.

	A black market is a term for the illegal selling of goods and services, including people. It is also known as an underground economy. (wikipedia.com) One such example would be if a person does work "under the table" - that is, working without paying taxes. The service itself may be legal but the way they sell that service is illegal. Thank you to editor looney_tunes for clarifying this for me.

questions.text: In my family everyone played sports; that is, everyone except for me. What does that make me?
questions.explanation:
black sheep.

	The black sheep is the person who is different from the others. Often it means different in a negative way but it does not have to mean that.

questions.text: Black coffee is coffee without sugar or cream in the United States, or coffee plain or with only sugar in Australia.
questions.explanation:
True.

	Some people like black coffee while others take sugar and cream. Some take it with just sugar, or just cream. Some put other things in their coffee such as flavorings.

questions.text: What is another name for black comedy?
questions.explanation:
dark comedy.

	A black comedy is one that makes light of a situation which normally would be very serious. An example of a TV series that is a black comedy is "M*A*S*H*", which makes light of the Korean War.
